intro: Pimpinella ramosa, commonly known as the branched cow-weed, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. The plant is often found in dry grasslands and along roadsides, and it is known for its aromatic properties.
